II. You are my wife. Therefore, out of my great love and affection for you, and with the good intention of providing you with some fixed income in the future without any deficiency in your livelihood, I hereby give you, free of charge and without consideration, the immovable property listed in the Schedule III below, which has come to me by inheritance, which has remained in my sole possession till date, and which no one else has any right to, with all the leasehold rights I have on the vacant land, valued at Rs. 3,10,000/- in letters, and which is immediately transferred to your possession. Therefore, from now on, you should get the property built, etc., registered in your name in the records of the Sri Government and Sri Panchayat, pay all the taxes yourself, and from now on, you should enjoy the happiness and freedom of your son and grandson with full rights of loan, donation, sale, and inheritance. There will be no mortgage or other encumbrances on this. This settlement document is written with my consent. Settlement details: Vizianagaram District, Sringavarapukotta Sa||8||A||, Jami Mandal,
Jami Madhura Ramayapalem (Kottavur) Gram Panchayat,
Jami Gram Revenue,

applicable to Residential Area,

sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No 3779 of 2025 dated 19/Aug/2025, executed by Nimmakayala Suridemudu in favour of his wife Nimmakayala Adilakshmi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 114Sq.Yds, comprised in survey number 684-3 situated in Jami Madhura Ramayyapalem village and Gram Panchayat, Jami Mandal within the District of Vizianagaram registered at sub-registrar office S.Kota is bounded as follows: North by: RCC House of Nimmakayala Jatlayya South by: C.C. Road East by: My vacant land West by: C.C. Road Note:: Schedule property is part of Gramakantam as per deed.

It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or
Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
